div.l: He crakid bost and saide it was not so
Thanne were þer pore clerkys two
That dueldyn in this halle of which I sey
Testif þey were and lusty forto pley
And only for hir myrthe and reuelrie
Vp on þe wardeyn bisily þey crye
To yeue hem leve but a litil stounde
To go to the mylle and se her corn y grounde
And hardely þey durste ley her necke
The myllere sholde not stele half a pecke
Of corn̄ be sleyȝte or bi force hem reue
And at þe laste þe wardeyn yaf hem leve
Iohn hiȝte þat on and Aleyn hiȝte þat oþ̉er
Of a toun were þey born̄ þᵗat hiȝte strodyr
Fer in the north I can not telle where
They makyn redy al hir owen gere
And on her hors þe sackis cast anon̄
Forth goth Aleyn þe clerk and eke Iohn
With good swerd ⁊and bokeler bi her side
Iohn knew þe wey him nedid no gide
And at þe mylle þe sak adoun̄ he leith
Aleyn spak first al hail Symond in feith
How faris þy faire douȝter and thi wif
Aleyn welcome ꝙquod Symkyn be my lif
And Iohn Also what how what do ye here
Symond quod he be god nede hath no pere
Hym bus serue him self þᵗat has no swayn̄
Or ellis he is a fool as clerkis sayn̄
Our mauncipil I hope he wol be ded
Swa workys ay there wangis in his hed
And þerfore I is come and þis Aleyn
To grynde our corn̄ and cary it agayn
I pray you spede vs heyn in þat ye may
It shal be do ꝙquod Symkyn be my fay
What wil ye do whilis it is in hond
